description: From Old French repaier (“to pay back”), from re- + paiier (“to pay”), from Latin pācāre (“to settle, to make peaceful”), from pāx (“peace”) + -ō (“forming verbs”). Equivalent to re- +‎ pay. Cognate with repacify and French repayer (“to pay again”).

verbs.description: repay (third-person singular simple present repays, present participle repaying, simple past and past participle repaid)

entries.meaning: Synonym of pay back in all senses.
examples: I finally repaid my student loans, just before sending my kids to college.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make worthwhile; to yield a result worth the effort.
examples: The possible importance of excessive androgen secretion and the ingestion of agents such as the fluorenamines may repay further investigation.
